intro: Tinus plagioneura, commonly known as the silverleaf tree, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rutaceae. It is native to southern Africa, particularly South Africa, where it thrives in coastal and mountainous regions. The tree is characterized by its silvery-green leaves, which are covered in fine, waxy hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. Its small, white flowers are clustered in inflorescences and are followed by small, round fruits. The plant is adapted to dry conditions and is often found in rocky or sandy soils.
